author: marcus.puchalla
title: Evolve Eternl
description: Eternl’s feature-rich user interface is complex, and inexperienced users in particular have a hard time getting started. And a growing Cardano user base forces us to optimize every aspect of Eternl.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposers stated a clear purpose in the proposal. Eternl is a light wallet widely known in Cardano community, and to support continuously growing Cardano user base, the next version of Eternl will be focusing on overhauling the user experience for new users while also providing experienced (professional) user with advanced features. Providing information to further support the problem statement would be great to show that the project would give a real impact to the product (e.g., survey for Eternl users about the user experience; testimony from a known figure in Eternl community).
From the concept itself, I believe that the project would bring a great improvement, as Eternl v2 will support multi-platform and enables interaction with various Cardano blockchain services in the future. The proposal also states the main risk, which is important for project developments.
f6_assessments.q1:
Eternl is a widely-used Cardano light wallet in the community, proving that the proposer team managed to deliver a reliable product, and I believe that the team is competent enough to deliver improvements to Eternl, although a more detailed information about the team members and their experiences would be helpful. Providing team profiles and their past projects will prove team’s ability and voters will be more likely to be confident that this project would be done smoothly.

The proposal provides a list of main tasks to be done in the development and future supported platforms, but lacks of detailed development timetable and resources used (including tools used for multiple platform development), which are very important to plan a multi-platform development. Each task in the list can be added with their development timeline (e.g. UI Redesign: August 2022 - September 2022), and multi-platform plan can be added with codebase used for each platform development.

The proposal also lacks of budget breakdown, which is also important to give voters details regarding fund allocation in the project. Providing salary rate and expected total work hours for the duration of the project would give a better vision for budgeting. Also, the resources required is not yet described in the proposal, which might affect the overall budget. Overall, the proposal should provide a more thorough information to provide a better proof that the proposal will be delivered smoothly from planning to implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a User Acceptance Test (UAT) review method to receive evaluation from real users, and mentions their end goal: all-around better wallet experience. However, there are no mentions regarding roadmap and metrics to measure progress mid-development. For auditability, there should be a roadmap with development goals for each month, so that the developer team and the community could track the development progress with clear understanding. The success metrics is also not clear enough, only mentioning the expected improvements after the project. Further describing about points in User Acceptance Test and the desired score or response from each point would provide a measurable success metric for the project, and can be used as a report to provide transparency to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: Eternl is a light wallet client that have been widely used by the Cardano community. This proposal will further improve the Eternl wallet experience, which will overhaul the user interface, data structures, and syncing processes of Eternl. This wallet would bring a lot of impact within Cardano ecosystem such as adoptions in dApps, games, DAOs, and more. They’ve also mentioned that finding future sustainability plan is a high priority.
f6_assessments.q1: The Eternl team have proven their ability deliver their product into the market, and since have become a widely used wallet. Although I have no doubt that they will deliver their product, including the team description is important for accountability. Yes they say it’s Tastenkunst GmbH, but I don’t see further explanation on what they are other than “..have been here since 2008”. Further more, there’s still a lack of budget breakdown detail, which is important since it will show how the fund will be used. A simple expected work hour for the next 6 month with salary rate should be sufficient, e.g iOS developer $50/hour for 288 hours of work, explain what are the role for each 4 core developers are, etc. Since this is a product, a conductible plan with roadmap is necessary, as it will show that they’re not only know what they’re doing, but also understand how long it took (i.e explaining each month’s target and goals). All in all, I really like this project, but unfortunately judging by the quality of this proposal, I have to give it a 3 out of 5. In future fund, I will gladly help them to write a better proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: As I mentioned before, this proposal doesn’t explain their roadmap in detail. KPI and metrics is also lacking detail. Providing KPI and metrics or goals is important for auditability, since the community could measure and expect their progress and performance each month. Yes, they’ve mentioned User Acceptance Test, but they didn’t include how they will measure it. Providing a simple list of question that will be asked to the participant would be sufficient. The measurement for success could also be made better, for example: satisfactory level of new user increased, good review, how much faster should the syncing time would be, number increase of sustainable load of wallet at a given time, etc. For auditability standpoint, unfortunately I have to give it 2 out of 5, since it only include brief explanation of UAT for metrics, and provide their website for auditability.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal does not directly target development of new Dapps on chain, but provides infractures that is critical in using third-party Dapps.

The current Eternl wallet UI is currently complex and daunting to use for newcomers, so a simpler design will help onboard new users and allow them to use Dapps in a seamless fashion.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal does not give much details regarding the experience of the development team.

The plan could give a more detailed schedule of the tasks required to deliver Eternl v2.
The current plan is too high-level to judge the feasibility of the proposal within the given 6-month timeframe.

However, depsite these shortcomings, the Tastenkunst GmbH team has a proven track record of developing a functional wallet, which gives confidence in their ability to successfully carry out this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Internal user acceptance tests are planned by the team, but they don't indicate whether any public information will be available for the community to audit the development progress.

Given that the team is requesting funds from the Catalyst Project, a commitment to public updates would be necessary for the community to witness the progress made.

The final milestone consists of the release of the Eternl wallet v2, where the public will be able to assess whether the proposal was carried out as planned.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal suggests receiving funding to help "evolve" their wallet even further. Eternl has been around for a while and is one of the most widely used wallets on Cardano. As stated in the proposal, they have around 45,000 daily active members and around 25% of all mainnet Cardano transactions are used from their wallet. An upgrade to this wallet will be beneficial to the community because it would affect so many daily users. The idea of the proposal is to create new/upgraded features that would allow for new users to join their wallet as well. This could help lead to the majority of users utilizing this wallet which would have a global impact on their product. This would be highly beneficial to the entire Cardano ecosystem because it will create a better wallet for so many users. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: It is easier determining how likely a proposal will be in implemented successfully when the project has already accomplished so much. This suggests that the team behind the project is trustworthy, and they already have a large community. The proposal includes a roadmap that includes a specific timeframe of completion set for 6 months out. It includes all of the features that will be implemented into their wallet and states how these changes will benefit new wallet users. The budget breakdown is simple, yet concise. It states that the requested funds will be distributed amongst their 4 developers there. Given all of these included metrics, it leads me to believe that the team will be able to implement this proposal successfully. There is also a large community that will help the team stay accountable to improving the wallet within the given timeframe of 6 months. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: The information included in this proposal is very significant. It is lead by a great team that has been successful in the past and has one of the ecosystems largest wallets. When assessing the potential success of a proposal, there are 2 things that can be very important to gauging this process. The first principle is transparency. In order to be successful, the community needs to be aware of this proposal and understand what utility it could bring to users on the blockchain. Being open and transparent as a project allows for trust to be built within the community and leads to community members who become invested in the project. This then leads to the second principle which is accountability. When there are loyal community members, they are likely to hold the team accountable to their specific goals and timeframes that have been listed in this proposal. It is great when there is a positive community because the form of accountability is always positive. They want access to the product as soon as possible and so that leads them to maintain conversation with the team. I believe that this will be easy for the Eternl team because they already have such a large community and a lot of daily users as stated in the proposal. The team just needs to make sure that they ensure that the community is aware of this proposal and the upgrades that would be associated with it. It is likely going to animate the community and lead to a larger impact if funded. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The Cardano community has adopted Eternl, a lightweight wallet client. This proposal will redesign Eternl's user interface, data structures, and synchronization procedures, significantly enhancing the Eternl wallet experience. The use of this wallet across dApps, games, DAOs, and other areas would have a significant impact on the Cardano ecosystem. Finding a long-term sustainability strategy has also been cited as a top goal. The project's likelihood of success is extremely high because the proposers are also employees of Tastenkunst. The proposal also says that there is little project risk. In terms of the proposal's effectiveness, I think it could be able to deal with the issue they are now trying to tackle.
f6_assessments.q1: Since the Eternl team has demonstrated its capacity to bring its product to market, it has grown in popularity as a wallet. Although I am certain that they will deliver their goods, it is crucial for accountability to include the team description. Yes, they identify it as Tastenkunst GmbH, but other than the statement that they ".. have been here since 2008," I can find no other information about who they are. Budget breakdown information is also still missing, which is critical because it will outline how the amount will be spent. It should be sufficient to list the simple projected work hours and remuneration for the upcoming six months, e.g., iOS developer $50/hour for 288 hours of labor, outlining the responsibilities of each of the four key developers, etc. Given that this is a product, a conductible plan with a roadmap is essential because it will demonstrate that the team members not only understand what they're doing but also how long it took to complete it (by outlining each month's aim and objectives). I truly appreciate the concept of this project, however based on how the proposal was laid out for us, it appears that many changes still need to be made in order to gain wider support.
f6_assessments.q2: I have to disagree with the currently provided details. The proposed plan doesn't go into great length about their roadmap. The specificity of KPIs and measures is also inadequate. Since the community may track their growth and performance each month, providing KPIs and metrics is crucial for auditability. The User Acceptance Test was discussed, but the method of measurement was left out. It would be sufficient to simply provide a list of the participant's upcoming queries. Additionally, the success criteria might be improved. For instance, the number of satisfied new users may be increased, as could the number of positive reviews, the speed at which the wallet should sync, how much it can hold at a given time, etc.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tried to bring changes upon eternl wallet by redesigning the currently existing wallet to be friendlier for newer user, yet it would also improved by having the advanced user add their own desired more advanced features. This would give impact by making the newer user having ease on learning and using eternl without any defect or downgrade on its features, resulting in more option and access upon Cardano’s wallet. Having Tastenkunst themselves that will hands on develop the eternl, I am certain of the proposal’s chance of success. The proposal has also included the risk assessment on the project, which they mentioned it is small.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has provided their milestones, yet they lack on providing the steps of action, or specific milestones on their project timeline, mentioning only the part that it will be running for 6 month. Should be improved by breaking down what item will be done on each week or month during the period. Considering from the timeline and what to be done, 6 months is still feasible, but should be broken down better.

The requested budget might be broken down better since it has not provided in the proposal. This should also include what will $90000 spent on, how much on development fee per hour for how many people, deployment cost, or even what resources and technical stuff that might be needed.

The proposal gave a very lacking information of who will be contributing, mentioning only that the team consists Tastenkunst employee and freelancers. More personal information such as background, experience, and relevant skills of core team member, especially the freelancers should have been provided to make it better.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has not provided any related reference or proposed access for public/community to watch the development progress, makes the auditability a bit lacking. There are also no objective to define the project progress too. The proposal mentioned that the finish line for the project is by providing better wallet experience for users, however it might be difficult and bias when evaluated. The metric to measure these points might be some increase in product usage, reaching ‘n’ number of users (considering that more users implies that user like to use the product), or by creating a survey on users asking of their liking to the ‘evolved’ eternl.

f6_assessments.q0: Eternl wallet has already been successfully launched and used by users in the ecosystem, and this proposal allows the wallet to be improved. As a user of this wallet, I agree that the user interface needs to be much simpler for non-technical users and improve its UI/UX design. The proposal does effectively addresses the challenge as it wants to provide an easier user journey for new users when using the wallet. Plus, many NFT projects now are promoting to use Nami or Eternl wallet, which I think its good to have a user-centric approach design. As funny as it sounds, but I suggest looking at the Terra Station wallet dashboard design - simple, easy to use as a new user, and uses colors to differentiate links and navigations. Another example of a good wallet design would be Near wallet, though the features differentiate with Eternl, but its minimal design reduces alot of visual tension for users when using it. Overall, I highly support the proposal so that it can be funded to improve its quality.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan presented is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. From the requested funds, I think the proposer could further explain its budget allocation eventhough they claim to use the funds to pay part of the developer's salaries over a period of 6 months. It should be mindful to state clearly these budget so that it will easily be auditable and clarified. Despite that, I think the team have relevant experience and have proven that they are very well equipped with the tools required to develop the project. The timeline and items lists provided are clearly defined. Though, from the item listed - redesign of the user interface and redefinition of the user flow, I feel that the proposer could provide a statement whereby they will be hiring a UI/UX designer for this. That is why I think the budget breakdown is important (even they have stated freelancers). We should easily know who will be working on specific tasks.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provide clarity in the problem statement and its solution to solve the current issues of the wallet. The roadmap is clear and this is an improvement of a very well delivered project. The team have a Discord channel whereby users can open a ticket to have their say on the project, give feedbacks and provide suggestions. This will be a good way to have a consant back-and-forth relationship with consumers. Though, the team could also provide metrics such as number of new users once the progress is done, and number of bugs/errors occured during the changes of the new version. I believe that the team can deliver the project and have several KPIs that are good indicators to evaluate their success.

f6_assessments.q0:
If you frequently use DEX exchanges, then Eternl wallet is an appropriate and convenient choice. This is not PR; rather, it is the experience of someone who has used many wallets for a long time like me, not only accumulating a large number of cryptocurrencies. The wallet is compatible with the majority of DEX exchanges, and it also has a feature that the majority of other wallets don't have, which is the ability to send as many tokens of your choice in a single transaction. This feature is very interesting, and it reduces the fees that are associated with the transaction. It is possible that your upgrade of the wallet to a lightweight and modular wallet could be an important step in making it easier for new users to do all the basics on the wallet. PRO users will be able to request additional advanced features after they have upgraded their wallet. From my point of view, it resolves the problem, contributes to improving the user experience, and develops the wallet to become a lightweight wallet with a superior number of users in comparison to other wallets.

You put the risk that the possibility of the company behind Tastenkunst shutting down is an unlikely thing, and if it does happen, it will only affect 50 percent of the team's ability to function, so I see it as reasonable. Since you put it that way, the risk is reasonable. I give this effect a score of 5 points.
f6_assessments.q1:
With the use of the funded money to pay the development team within six months, I think it can be an incentive for Wallet developers to have more striving to help develop the wallet into a cross-platform lightweight wallet faster, which is able to exceed expectations, which is a great thing. I think this could be an incentive for Wallet developers to have more striving to help develop the wallet. The organization will conduct closed beta tests so that it can obtain the feedback of the participants regarding the wallet application that can be accessed through web platforms, browser extensions, and mobile applications. create an upgrade to Etenl V2. From that vantage point, we are able to observe the meticulous preparation that the team has made for the release of the upgrade, which will result in the upgrade being more comprehensive, less prone to errors that are superfluous, and possibly containing some additional functions that we require. can be anticipated to become available in the not too distant future.

Regarding the cost of the project, I do not find it to be very clear. I believe that you should add more factors, such as the amount of money that will be spent on the salaries of the four project developers on an hourly, daily, and monthly basis.

The community requires more specificity and clarity. Your group is a part of the company Tastenkunst GmbH, but I think you should have a link to the company's website. I haven't been able to check it out just yet, and this could be a detriment to the success of your project. Therefore, I will award the maximum possible 4 points.
f6_assessments.q2:
It's a good idea to test it out for pro users, newbies, but I haven't seen you post that on any group or discord group site. any. I haven't seen a link that leads to you going to demonstrate that you're going to get community input. Another problem is that the ability to track and stick to the project progress so that the community can evaluate, monitor and follow up has not been clearly stated in your proposal.
Regarding the success of the project you mentioned, it is keeping up with the development speed of Blockchain, but still ensuring the simplicity, ease of use and not cumbersome while ensuring the security of the blockchain. wallet users, that can be a great thing for the community. Hope you will be funded, so that the project can be successful. I give this auditability 4 points.

solution: We'll develop the next version of Eternl as a modular wallet app. A simpler design will make it easier for new Cardano users to get started. Pro users will be able to add advanced features on demand.
experience:
Eternl is an essential part of the Cardano ecosystem for about a year now.
We’ve built a feature-rich multi-platform Cardano light wallet which serves around 45000 accounts on a daily basis. About 25% of all Cardano Mainnet transactions are submitted through our infrastructure.
